content.question: Which of the following best describes a way that persistent organic pollutants (<math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) cause harm in the environment?

choices.label: Persistent organic pollutants release carbon dioxide and methane into the atmosphere when buried for disposal.
Persistent organic pollutants release radioactivity during decay.
Persistent organic pollutants are soluble in fat, so they accumulate in an organisms’ fatty tissues.
Persistent organic pollutants have magnetic signatures that confuse birds during migration.

content.answer: Persistent organic pollutants are soluble in fat, so they accumulate in an organisms’ fatty tissues.
